name: Reads Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: reads hotel is set in the most beautiful gardens surrouned by mountains and and is a peaceful retreat for any one looking for Quiet, the house is wounderful so many lovely things to look at, the staff are so friendly and can not do enough to make your stay more pleasureable they are always kind and friendly which is just what you need. The food is fantastic you have the choice of eating bistro which is wounderful or the beautiful restaurant with there high class cuisine. This is our 8th visit and every time has been as good as the last. The owners viv and Iris read along with there family are english and run this beautiful hotel with the greatest admiration.
reviews.title: reads hotel the most beautiful

reviews.text: Stayed at Reads for the 9th time in 13 years and had another great holiday. What is so nice about Reads is that it is like being a paying guest in someone's beautiful home.
reviews.title: Just as nice as ever

reviews.text: Another thing we like is the friendly clientele which is mostly British and German and everyone gets on so well. The place is never crowded so no need to rush to the pool to reserve your sun beds.
reviews.title: Just stayed there for two nights after 5...
A joy - perfect for a "get away from it all" break
reviews.text: Our children have been coming with us since 1997 and like it just as much as we do.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Michelin-starred Marc Fosh has now moved on to open his own restaurant but his replacement Felix is every bit as good and we really enjoyed his food and told him so.
reviews.title: The Ultimate Destination for Relaxation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel is located in a small village 20 minutes from palma. the rooms are comfortable, large with picturesque view from the windows. The staff friendly and attentive and make you feel at home. The 2 restaurants serve gourmet food and the atmosphere is romantic and elegant. We loved every moment over there and would recommend it to our friends.
reviews.title: excellent hotel, beautiful and quiet rooms, rustic mediterenian view, execellent restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you long for a real getaway, an escape to somewhere truly tranquil, the experience of warm hospitality and divine food in the most beautiful surroundings, then you've found it.
reviews.title: SILENCE IS GOLDEN

reviews.text: Reads Hotel is a beautifully sympathetic renovation of a Mallorcan country house, artfully filled with an eclectic mix of tasteful objects and antiques - yet in no way stuffy - areas are very open and airy with high cielings and cool tiled floors. Outside, the expansive gardens are delightfully laid out and very well kept and lovingly cared for - Mr Read himself is often to be seen working there.
reviews.title: Nothing is too much trouble!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will be a world away from the stress and trappings of everyday life -
reviews.title: The Place to go for relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (they don't even allow the use of mobile phones outside your room - fantastic!)
reviews.title: A Gem

reviews.text: We stayed at Reads Hotel in July this year as a place to chill and relax. It certainly lived up to and surpassed our expectations. The hotel is an old manor house renovated with charm and full of beautiful antiques. Our room in the main building was huge with a wonderful view over the grounds and a massive bathroom. We slept incredibly well and it was lovely each morning to open the shutters and lie in bed looking out at the view.
reviews.title: An oasis of peace and luxury.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mr Read was kind enough to show us some of the other rooms and suites and they were amazing- even more impressive than the pictures on the website! The Morroccan suite is incredible with so much attention to detail and even a twinkling star ceiling in the bathroom!. Some of the rooms are separate to the main house if you want to be really private, but we liked being in the old part.
reviews.title: Reads Mallorca, Wonderful.

reviews.text: Breakfast is taken in the Bacchus room and is buffet style with cooked options if you wished, but there was so much choice of cakes, breads cheeses and fruits, we never bothered. The walls are painted with incredible murals and it must look wonderful in the evening.
reviews.title: Wonderful hospitality and surroundings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our meals round the pool to take advantage of the weather and the food was incredible. Everything, even the sandwiches at lunchtime, was beautifully prepared and delicious. We didn't bother going out of the hotel and ate there every night. There was enough choice that we weren't restricted by the menu and there were daily specials. We felt the wine was very reasonable as well. Our 17 year old had the same starter at least three times and Felix, the head chef kindly emailed us the recipe when we returned home. We stayed a week and I could have stayed longer, especially if we had hired a car and had trips out. My husband and son went out on the hotel bikes one day and said they were very good and well maintained.
reviews.title: Peaceful luxury

reviews.text: The purpose built spa is wonderful. We went in every day and also had treatments which were fantastic. Most of the time we just lounged around and waited for our next meal!
reviews.title: The kind of place which makes you feel as if you are staying in someone's home, not a hotel.

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights with 5 girlfriends and it was such a relaxing break. We arrived around 9.30 am and our rooms were ready within 40 minutes. While we waited we were offered complimentary drinks on the terrace which was a lovely touch and very much appreciated. We sat round the pool all day only moving to sit in the shade to eat lunch (which was delicious). In the evening we ate in the bistro - again the food was delicious and suited our tastes more than the menu in the main restaurant.
reviews.title: Perfect place to unwind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a cookery session the next day and around noon made our way into the kitchens where we made a three course lunch (with a lot of help from Felix) - it was great fun and the other guests were very interested to see our creations when they were served to us on the terrace. In the evening we took a taxi into Palma. Just note that due to the rather isolated location of Reads, it might be necessary to book taxis in advance. It's not the sort of place to just hail a cab. If you want peace and tranquility, then this is the place to stay. The hotel has been lovingly renovated and has an eclectic collection of paintings, antiques and crockery throughout.
reviews.title: Reads provides a wonderfully relaxing experience with excellent service and superb food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reads was obviously established with a huge amount of thought and a similar amount of expense. The house and gardens are laid out so that there are lots of little nooks and carannies for guests to enjoy the peace and quiet of this delightful small (well not really so small, but not many rooms) hotel. It is off the beaten Majorcan track, yet only minutes away from Palma.
reviews.title: Thanks so much to Reads for an absolutely amazing wedding day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was large and comfortable, with a spacious living room, large bedroom, and huge bathroom. There were Bang & Olufsen TVs in both rooms, though we did not use them much. It was great to have sunbeds on our own little patio, though the weather did not allow us to use them (a few days later it would have!). The room was kept clean and tidy. We did have a small problem with a sticky room key, but that was solved by the staff very quickly. Also worth noting was that towels and dressing gowns were not the best quality (though plenty were provided).
reviews.title: There's nowhere better on Mallorca!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not have the opportunity to take advantage of the outside pool, but it looked very inviting.
reviews.title: Most beautiful relaxing place with lovely staff!

aka: Reads Hotel Santa Maria Del Cami
description: Reads offers the ultimate chill out experience. Enjoy the 650m2 Vespasian Spa offering heated indoor pool with hydro-therapy jets, jacuzzi, thermal circuit steam room; sauna; laconium; ice cave; foot reflexology podium and 5 experience shower. Treatment rooms and a couples suite offer a full range of ESPA and Vespasian Signature treatments. Open all year, this privately owned, luxury hotel with just 23 rooms and its own vineyard, is just 20 minutes from the city of Palma. The Hotel has two restaurants both with outdoor dining terrace. An outdoor pool, tennis court and dedicated cycling centre add to the many activities available onsite.
